intro: Liabum isodontum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
